JobFullDesc: As one of the world’s leading asset managers, we are solely dedicated to delivering an investment experience that helps people get more out of life. If you're looking for challenging work, smart colleagues, and a global employer with a social conscience, explore your potential at Invesco.Your RoleAs a member of the Portfolio Management Team for Invesco’s US Core Fund, the Associate Director will directly participate in the execution and communication of both the operational and investment strategy of the Fund.You will be responsible for: Assist in the development and execution of the Fund’s investment plan Conduct detailed Fund-level financial analysis, as well as forward performance projections at the Fund and asset level Evaluate Fund Level Performance, including taking advantage of various Industry information, and provide the Portfolio Team with meaningful takeaways to improve going forward performance Participate in the ongoing execution of the property level business plans for the Fund by working closely with asset management to manage and optimize the existing asset portfolio Participate in the evaluation of new investments for the Fund Conduct internal underwriting of existing assets and prepare investment committee packages for assets marked for disposition Assist in the coordination of the debt financing including both secured and unsecured financing Monitor and evaluate property level performance Assist in the client reporting process and in the financial management of the Fund Participate in ongoing client service and capital raising efforts Conduct ongoing competitive analysis of peer funds The experience you bring: Minimum of 4 years; experience across multiple real estate disciplines a plus Familiarity with industry benchmarks and NPI-ODCE Funds a plus Undergraduate Degree, MBA preferred Strong written and oral communications skills Excellent interpersonal skills in a team-oriented environment Argus proficiency / real estate valuation skills Sense of urgency Proven practical understanding of real estate investment concepts – appreciation of broader investment (stocks, bonds etc.) concepts a plus Excellent analytical skills and attention to detail Highly proficient in Microsoft Excel, and ability to learn new softwareWhat’s in it for you?Our people are at the very core of our success.
